meanings.definition: Form a theory or conjecture about a subject without firm evidence.
meanings.sent1: She was speculating about what might happen next in the story.
meanings.sent2: The students were speculating on the outcome of the science experiment.
meanings.sent3: While speculating about the weather, he guessed it would rain frogs!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a busy marketplace, speculating on every passing thought.
meanings.sent5: Speculating about the future made her feel excited and curious.

meanings.definition: Invest in stocks, property, or other ventures in the hope of gain but with the risk of loss.
meanings.sent1: He was speculating on buying shares in the new company.
meanings.sent2: Many people enjoy speculating in real estate to make a profit.
meanings.sent3: Speculating on the lottery numbers, she dreamt of winning a million dollars.
meanings.sent4: His heart raced as he stood on the edge, speculating on the jump ahead.
meanings.sent5: The thrill of speculating in the stock market kept him on his toes.
